result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Allen Lucht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs 
*Minimum of $75/month to be paid towards the fine and costs 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments deemed appropriate  by the agent and follow any recommendations for any assessments

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Not Eligible for challenge incarceration.
Not Eligible for substance abuse.
Continue with previous conditions.
Engage with counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Do not have contact, direct or indirect, with M.M, with the exception of a third party to use for visitation matters with child.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Allen Lucht in court with Attorney (Atty) Melissa Hope Dalkert. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody.

9:45 AM Court calls case.
Atty Wetzsteon states appearances.

This is a sentencing after revocation hearing.

Court received a revocation order and warrant.
Defendant was not able to comply with comditions and Defendant has returned.

State has received the packet and is ready to proceed.
Atty Dalkert has been appointed for today's hearing, has received the packet and is prepared to proceed as well.

State does not indicate in his notes that witness was notified.
9:47 AM State takes a moment to check with the DA's office.

9:51 AM Court is back in session.
Court and Defense previously discussed victim, it is an odd charge.
State did not receive any notice for request from victim about any upcoming hearings.

Atty Wetzsteon addresses the Court regarding sentencing, recommends a 6 year prison sentence.
Atty Dalkert addresses the Court regarding sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 40 months
Initial Confinement for 20 months - 337 days credit
Extended Supervision for 20 months
Not Eligible for challenge incarceration
Not Eligible for substance abuse
Conditions:
Pay court costs and fine
To be taken out of prison account at a reasonable rate determined by department of corrections
Continue with previous conditions
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Engage with counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Do not have contact, direct or indirect, with M.M, with the exception of a third party to use for visitation matters with child

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Allen Lucht in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:36 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Drengler agrees to the convictions for repeater status. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
3 days credit.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Pay fine of $1,000 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Minimum of $75 per month be paid towards the fine and costs.  
Obtain and/or maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and follow any recommendations for any assessments. 

Court advises of post-conviction.
Plea hearing on December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Allen Lucht in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brandon Allen Lucht in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:33 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Drengler is asking the Court to adjourn this matter for a short period of time and makes his statements on the record.
Court reviews the status of the case.
Court questions Atty Drengler what he is requesting; Atty Drengler is requesting a Pre-Trial Conference.
Court questions if bond had been set.
Court addresses bond.
Atty Cousins would request a signature bond of $1,500 with conditions stated on the record.
Atty Drengler would request the same signature bond.
Atty Drengler provides the sentencing of the defendant on his Waupaca County cases.
Atty Drengler makes additional statements on the record.
Court verifies the address of the defendant and will be residing with his father.
Court questions Atty Drengler as to why his client had contact with M.M. when he was ordered not to; Atty Drengler makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Case will impose the original $2,500 signature bond with no conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
